rule: The sentences must remain grammatically correct after the addition of the formatting tags.
input: Cats sleep. Dogs bark. Birds sing.
validityText:
The input specification requires that the input must be a paragraph of text containing at least three sentences. The input provided contains three sentences: "Cats sleep.", "Dogs bark.", and "Birds sing.". Each of these sentences is complete and punctuated appropriately. Since the input specification does not impose any constraints on the length, complexity, or content of the sentences, simply requiring that there are at least three of them, the input meets the requirement of having three proper sentences.

No violation.
OK
coverageText:
```html

Dogs are known to bark. This is a common way for them to communicate.

Many birds are known for their ability to sing. Their songs can be heard throughout the day.

```
